text:
When I shutdown apache - the logrotate on one of the logs (I have two logs - 
one for access and one for error)failed unexpectedly and leaving a child behind.

I checked and see the child id has changed before and after shutdown - 
therefore, I suspected the child has restarted itself after the apachectl stop 
command has issued.

[Mon May 12 17:11:32 2003] [notice] Apache/2.0.45 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.0.45 
OpenSSL/0.9.7b configured -- resuming normal operations
piped log 
program ' /usr/local/apache/bin/rotatelogs /home/www/bb03.startv.com/logs/access
_log 21600' failed unexpectedly
[Mon May 12 17:11:42 2003] [notice] caught SIGTERM, shutting down
creator: kachan@vicosys.com.hk
trawick@apache.org
text:
problem now fixed in 2.1-dev

thanks for your report!


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 24805 ***
